author: Crumbles8
title: I can't wait to return
text:
I stayed for four nights last week on business. The front of house, concierge and doormen are the friendliest and most welcoming I have ever encountered.
The architectural restoration of the building and the interior design is breathtaking and the atrium mesmerising: I spent a couple of hours in the bar and saw many people come in simply to view the atrium.
The bar itself is stunning and, given its obvious popularity, I believe will become one of the iconic New York bars.
The rooms are tasteful and while admittedly newly refurbished, contrast markedly with the usual 'tired' New York hotel room.
The only area to improve is the billing system or (more likely) the training of those who use it: there were things missing from my bar bill (which I added back) and things incorrectly billed for room service.
And on an aesthetic point (and out of the proprietors' control) are the mandatorily bright red fire exit signs plastered on every corner of each floor of the atrium: a travesty given that the technology exists to make them discrete until an alarm is sounded.
